intro: Aclisia indica, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aclisia indica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
